properties.Name: DividendType
properties.Description:
A categorization of dividends based on their payment characteristics or objectives.

Ex:
- Accumulated Dividend
- Accumulative Dividend
- Cash Dividend
- Equalizing Dividend
- Extra ("Special") Dividend
- Extra Dividend
- Interim Dividend
- Liquidating Dividend
- Optional Dividend
- Participating Dividend
- Stock And Cash Dividend
- Stock Dividend
- Stock Dividend
- Year-End Dividend

where:

ACCUMULATED DIVIDEND
A dividend due to holders of cumulative preferred stock that is not paid but is actually carried on the books as a liability until it is paid.

Until the dividend is paid, it is carried on the corporation's books as a liability.

ACCUMULATIVE DIVIDEND
A dividend due to stockholders of cumulative preferred stock that has not been paid to them.

 Until the dividend is paid, it is carried on the corporation's books as a liability.

CASH DIVIDEND
A cash payment to a corporation's shareholders that is distributed from current earnings or accumulated profits.

A cash dividend is taxable as income.

A dividend paid in cash to a company's shareholders. The amount is normally based on profitability and is taxable as income. A cash distribution may include capital gains and return of capital in addition to the dividend.

EQUALIZING DIVIDEND
A special dividend that is paid to compensate investors for income lost because a change was made in the quarterly dividend payment schedule.

EXTRA ("SPECIAL") DIVIDEND
A dividend that is paid in addition to a firm's regular dividend.

EXTRA DIVIDEND
A dividend paid to shareholders in addition to the regular dividend.   This payment is made after a particularly profitable period to reward shareholders.

INTERIM DIVIDEND
A dividend declared and paid before annual earnings have been determined.

LIQUIDATING DIVIDEND
A distribution of assets from a corporation that is going out of business or being liquidated. Management may decide to sell off a company's assets and pass the proceeds along to shareholders.

OPTIONAL DIVIDEND
A dividend that can be paid either in cash or in stock based upon the shareholders decision.

PARTICIPATING DIVIDEND
A dividend paid on participating preferred stock.

STOCK AND CASH DIVIDEND
A dividend that consists of both cash and some percentage of stock.

STOCK DIVIDEND
A dividend that is paid in securities, rather than cash. The additional shares may be of the issuing company, or of a subsidiary.

STOCK DIVIDEND
A dividend paid as additional shares of stock rather than as cash.

YEAR-END DIVIDEND
A dividend declared at the end-of-year.

Columns.Name: DividendTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Dividend Type.

Columns.Name: DividendTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of a Dividend Type.

Columns.Name: DividendTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Dividend Type.
